meanings.sent1: The curtains in the room were lightproof, keeping the sunlight out completely.
meanings.sent2: She bought a lightproof case for her camera to protect it from any damage.
meanings.sent3: The lightproof umbrella made the sun feel like a mischievous prankster trying to peek through.
meanings.sent4: His heart was lightproof, shielding itself from any emotional exposure.
meanings.sent5: The lightproof paint created a darkness so deep, it seemed to swallow all the light around it.

meanings.definition: Designed to prevent light from entering or escaping.
meanings.sent1: The lightproof safe kept all the valuable items hidden from view.
meanings.sent2: The lightproof door was essential for the darkroom to function properly.
meanings.sent3: The lightproof curtains played a game of hide-and-seek with the sun, always winning.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a lightproof vault, locking away memories she wished to forget.
meanings.sent5: The lightproof container sealed the secrets within, never to be revealed.

meanings.definition: A material or object that does not allow light to pass through.
meanings.sent1: He used a lightproof bag to store the undeveloped film.
meanings.sent2: The lightproof box was perfect for storing light-sensitive items.
meanings.sent3: The lightproof goggles made everything appear dim and mysterious.
meanings.sent4: The lightproof barrier blocked the path of the intrusive sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The lightproof fabric created a cocoon of darkness, perfect for a good night's sleep.
